summary: This bill, the "No Corruption in Government Act," introduces several ethics reforms for Congress. It prohibits Members of Congress and their spouses from holding or trading individual stocks and similar financial instruments, with exceptions for diversified funds and blind trusts. It extends the post-employment lobbying ban to six years for former Senators and three years for former House members. Finally, the bill eliminates the automatic annual cost-of-living pay adjustment for members of Congress, requiring any future pay raises to be approved through separate legislation. The act aims to increase transparency and reduce potential conflicts of interest.
